French farmers block highways over culling of diseased cattle
byline: By Raphaëlle Bacqué (Carbonne (southern France), special correspondent)
subhed: In response to an epidemic of contagious nodular dermatitis, farmers opposed to the government's animal health policy peacefully barricaded the A64 highway near Toulouse, the same site where a farmers' protest movement began in January 2024.

title: Bardella supports far-right RN proposal to bring back brothels in France
subhed: 'We can set up secure enclosed spaces to prevent this activity, which exists regardless of what we do, from taking place in extremely unsanitary and unsafe conditions,' the far-right presidential contender in France's 2027 elections said on Saturday.

title: Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhed: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.

title: Louvre heist puts French museums on high alert
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Laurent Telo
subhed: Seven cultural institutions in France experienced burglaries with increasingly violent methods between September and October, revealing significant shortcomings in their security measures.

subhed: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.

title: How French spies, police and military personnel are betrayed by advertising data
subhed: Using easily accessible advertising data, Le Monde was able to pinpoint the identities, home addresses and daily routines of several dozen people working for sensitive official entities.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhed: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.
